org.divxdede.swing

Class RemainingTimeMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.divxdede.swing.RemainingTimeMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable

    public class RemainingTimeMonitor
extends Object
implements Disposable
    Tools class that compute remaining time of a long duration task.
    The task progression is represented by the common interface BoundedRangeModel.

    RemainingTimeMonitor store few past samples of the advance progression's speed and use it for compute the remaining time.

    This monitor use at least the last 10s to do estimation but it can use greater samples depending on how much frequently the BoundedRangeModel fire changes.

    Exemple: 

              // Create a tracker
          RemainingTimeMonitor rtp = new RemainingTimeMonitor( myModel );

          // Just simply call #getRemainingTime()
          long remainingTime = getRemainingTime();
          if( remainingTime != -1 ) {
              // you have a remaining time, you can re-invoke this method for update the remaining time
          }
    Since:
    1.2
    Author:
    André Sébastien (divxdede)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemainingTimeMonitor

        public RemainingTimeMonitor(BoundedRangeModel model)
        Create a RemainingTimeMonitor for the specified BoundedRangeModel.
        This instance will use at least samples for a total of 30s.
        Parameters:
        model - BoundedRangeModel for which compute the remaining time

    • Method Detail

      • getModel

        public BoundedRangeModel getModel()
        Return the monitored model by this RemainingTimeMonitor.
        Returns:
        Monitored model

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Free resources.
        After this method call, this tool don't monitor anymore the underlying BoundedRangeModel
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable

      • hasNewerEstimation

        public boolean hasNewerEstimation()
        Indicate if getRemainingTime() can give a result based on a new estimation. If this method returns false, it means the getRemainingTime() will give a result based on the last estimation.
        Returns:
        true if getRemainingTime() will give a result based on a new estimation. false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.2.2

      • getRemainingTime

        public long getRemainingTime(TimeUnit unit)
        Compute the remaining time of the task underlying the BoundedRangeModel.
        This tool monitor and analysys the task advance speed and compute a predicted remaining time.
        If it has'nt sufficient informations in order to compute the remaining time and will return -1
        Parameters:
        unit - Specificy the time unit to use for return the remaining time (ex: TimeUnit.SECONDS)
        Returns:
        Remaining time in milliseconds of the task underlying the BoundedRangeModel

      • getRemainingTime

        public long getRemainingTime()
        Compute the remaining time of the task underlying the BoundedRangeModel.
        This tool monitor and analysys the task advance speed and compute a predicted remaining time.
        If it has'nt sufficient informations in order to compute the remaining time it will return -1 In the counterpart, if the monitoring sample can't compute a finite task duration, it will return Long.MAX_VALUE
        Returns:
        Remaining time in milliseconds of the task underlying the BoundedRangeModel

      • getRatio

        public static float getRatio(BoundedRangeModel brm)
        Return the current advance ratio of the specified BoundedRangeModel. This advance is given as a ratio [0 ~ 1] where 0 = 0% and 1 == 100%
        Parameters:
        model - BoundedRangeModel for which we want to determine the current advance ratio
        Returns:
        Curent advance of the specidiedBoundedRangeModel.
        See Also:
        #getSignificantRatioOffset()
